intro: Camellia japonica f. ilicifolia, commonly known as the Japanese holly camellia, is a compact evergreen shrub native to Japan. It is characterized by its dense, leathery foliage that resembles holly leaves, giving it its common name. The plant produces showy, double pink or white flowers in late winter to early spring. It thrives in partial shade and well-drained soil, making it suitable for garden borders or containers. Its ornamental value lies in both its foliage and floral display, making it a popular choice for ornamental gardening.
